summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center to whom discovery materials are being provided in her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal transmittal of discovery materials from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell in her detention facility.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn under inmate number 02879-509 as of August 2021.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The correspondence indicates the ongoing legal proceedings and discovery process in Maxwell's criminal case.
